DataElement.preferredName: Patient Imaging Procedure Sponsor Approved PET and CT Scan Medical Device Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status of patient eligibility verification for the performance of imaging studies on sponsor approved scanners as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Imaging Technique Clinical Study Sponsor Approved Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan Medical Device Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._An individual, company, institution, or organization that takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical trial. NOTE: If there is also a secondary sponsor, the responsible entity would be considered the primary sponsor. A corporation or agency whose employees conduct the investigation is considered a sponsor and the employees are considered investigators. [After ICH E6, WHO, 21 CFR 50.3 (e), and after IDMP] See also secondary sponsor._Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval._An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._Having been established or verified._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Imaging Technique Clinical Study Sponsor Approval Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan Medical Device Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.:Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.:Having been established or verified.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Concepts.longName: Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan
Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
